adshotrunner

Class AdShot

  • java.lang.Object
    • adshotrunner.AdShot

  • public class AdShot
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains the URL, list of tag images, screenshot image, and possible error for an AdShot. Optional setting to flag as a tag. Tags receive less load time and no javascript is injected.
    Author:
    juicio

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static AdShot create(java.lang.String pageURL)
        Creates an instance of an AdShot using the passed URLs. If no protocol precedes the URL, "http" is added. If the URL is null or empty, an AdShotRunnerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        pageURL - URL where the screenshot should be taken
        Returns:

      • create

        public static AdShot create(java.lang.String pageURL,
            java.util.Set<adshotrunner.TagImage> pageTagImages)
        Creates an instance of an AdShot using the passed URL, set of tag images, and whether or not the instance should be treated as a tag. If no protocol precedes the URL, "http" is added. If the URL is null or empty, an AdShotRunnerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        pageURL - URL where the screenshot should be taken
        pageTagImages - Set of tag images to be inserted into the page
        Returns:

      • addTagImage

        public void addTagImage(adshotrunner.TagImage newTagImage)
        Adds a new tag image to be inserted into the page.
        Parameters:
        newTagImage - New tag image to be inserted into the page

      • url

        public java.lang.String url()
        Returns:
        URL for the screenshot

      • tagImages

        public java.util.Set<adshotrunner.TagImage> tagImages()
        Returns:
        List of tag images to insert into the page (unmodifiable)

      • image

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage image()
        Returns:
        Image of the final screenshot. Default: null

      • finalURL

        public java.lang.String finalURL()
        Returns:
        Final URL after redirects of the final screenshot. Default: null

      • error

        public java.lang.Exception error()
        Returns:
        Possible error that occurred during screenshot attempt. Default: null
